translation.en: Man 1: I've been down and read this case file.
Every interview, everything that's in that file.
translation.ko: 그 안에 있는 모든 인터뷰를 읽어봤다고

translation.en: Where you live...
Man 2: I know it. That's what gets me, man.
Man 1: You know? Not a lot of very good suspects in there.
I know it.
Man 3: This girl passed on the street and he said, "I'd like...
translation.ko: 지나가는 여자애 보고 그랬어요 '쟤 강간하고 죽여버리고 싶어'

translation.en: I'd like to rape her and kill her."
He had the knife in his hand like this. And he was stabbing.
translation.ko: "데비 수 카터, 귀중한 딸 예수 안에 잠들다" 칼을 이렇게 쥐고 - 응 - 그걸로 찔렀어요

translation.en: -Man 1: Hard? -Yes.
-Man 1: How hard? Show me how hard. -Enough to get the full blade in.
translation.ko: 얼마나? - 직접 보여줘 - 끝까지 들어갈 정도로요

translation.en: Man 1: Did she beg y'all not to hurt her or...?
translation.ko: "드니스 해러웨이 나를 보고 배워라" 해치지 말라고 빌기도 했어?

translation.en: She goes, "Tommy, I didn't think you'd ever do anything like this."
We had it all planned out, you know...
Man 1: What were you planning on doing with her after you got her?
Raping her.
-Man 1: Raping her and then killing her? -Yes.
translation.ko: - 그 후에는 죽이려고 한 거야? - 네

translation.en: I knew I wouldn't have done it if I wasn't drunk.
translation.ko: 만약 취하지 않았으면 안 했을 거예요

translation.en: 'Cause I thought it was just a dream.
[Pastor] What do you say there, young man?
-[man] Good. How you doing? -I'm here.
-[man] Yup, me, too. -I'm... [chuckles]
[Pastor] I'm just so happy.
Well, if I was any happier, I'd be triplets.
-How about you? -[man] Yeah.
Okay.
Two hundred and fifty-four.
[Pastor] Here we go.
[Judge] Well, I tell people Ada's halfway between Dallas and Oklahoma City
translation.ko: 에이다를 소개할 땐 댈러스와 오클라호마시티 중간에서

translation.en: and a little bit east.
The smith plant located out there, in the southwest part of town,
translation.ko: 지역 남서쪽에는 시멘트 공장이 하나 있는데

translation.en: it's probably been there since 1906.
Ada's not a bad town, uh, you know, I grew up in towns like Ada.
translation.ko: 에이다는 괜찮은 동네예요 제가 자란 곳이랑 비슷하죠

translation.en: Everybody goes to the high school football game on Friday night and, you know,
translation.ko: 다들 금요일 밤이 되면 고등학교 미식축구 경기를 보고

translation.en: the businessmen go to the Rotary Club,
and people hang out in the coffee shops for breakfast, and, um...
You know, it's a close-knit community.
One of the things that people notice is that when they come here,
translation.ko: 에이다에 오는 사람들이 인상적이라고 생각하는 건데

translation.en: we just about have a church on every corner.
Lutheran, Methodist, lots of Baptist.
translation.ko: 루터교, 감리교도 있고 침례교가 특히 많죠

translation.en: ♪ Leaning, leaning... ♪
[Cristy] This area of the state
is really known for pecans. We have a lot of pecan groves around here.
translation.ko: 피칸으로 아주 유명해요 피칸밭이 수두룩한 곳이죠

translation.en: You know, some pretty views and things like that.
And then, sadly,
some, you know, a couple of pretty notorious murders
translation.ko: 꽤 악명 높은 살인 사건 두 건이

translation.en: that happened here.
♪ Amen. ♪
[tsks] I've written 40 books.
And this was halfway through my career.
Innocent Man was book number 20 I think.
And it was my only, um...
foray in the nonfiction.
I'd never researched a novel to that extent before.
translation.ko: 그렇게까지 조사해서 장편을 쓴 건 처음이었어요

translation.en: If I wrote the-- The Innocent Man as a... novel,
fiction,
folks probably wouldn't believe it.
[woman] We're going to the storage unit, uh... to see the exhibits
translation.ko: 보관실로 가는 중이에요 보관실 안에 "돈 틸 폰토톡 카운티 법원 속기사"

translation.en: that are kept in storage.
My storage.
Any exhibit that's been admitted into evidence
is kept by the court reporter.
So I still have all the exhibits.
This is "hair found under body."
This was under Debbie Carter's body in her apartment.
translation.ko: 자택에서 숨진 데비 카터 시신에서 나온 거죠

translation.en: And it's sealed. It has not been opened.
These are the hair slides, and you can see that they're labeled.
translation.ko: 체모 깔유리인데 각각 이름이 쓰여 있어요

translation.en: This is her western belt, which has her name.
translation.ko: 이건 데비의 이름이 새겨진 웨스턴 벨트예요

translation.en: I don't know if you can see that or not.
It has "Debbie."
This is the electric blanket, um, cord. [sighs]
[man] What was the significance of that?
Might be what they strangled her with, or he strangled her with.
translation.ko: 여럿이 했든 혼자 했든 이걸로 목을 조른 것 같아요

translation.en: I'll turn it this way, so that you can see it.
I don't really want to pull that out of there.
I mean, for me to touch it. I don't really want to.
-[woman] What is it? -It's the ketchup bottle, um...
that was...
used on her.
I... A torture tool or a murder weapon.
translation.ko: 고문 도구라고 할지 살해 흉기라고 할지

translation.en: I don't know what you would have labeled it.
But the, um, ketchup bottle...
I mean, the lid, the ketchup bottle lid was found inside of her body.
translation.ko: 그러니까 이 통의 뚜껑이 시신 속에서 발견됐어요

translation.en: So he did stuff with this.
These are letters from Debbie's family members.
translation.ko: 이 편지들은 데비의 가족들이 작성한 거예요

translation.en: This one is from Peggy Carter, which is her mother.
translation.ko: 이건 데비의 어머니인 페기 카터의 글인데요

translation.en: It says, "The first thing I want people
to know about Debbie is I loved her so much.
We were very close and did a lot of things together.
translation.ko: '우린 매우 친했고 함께 많은 추억을 쌓았습니다'

translation.en: We did friends things together.
She was not only my daughter, but my friend.
She was a picky person. Feisty. Full of energy and life.
She loved life.
She was very outgoing, a people person.
Almost always had a smile on her face and very modest.
She was a quiet person.
She was a good girl with a lot of morals.
I've never heard anybody who didn't like Debbie."
[woman] So... this is where Debbie's apartment was.
She moved here on October the 8th,
translation.ko: 10월 8일에 이사 왔고 "크리스티 셰퍼드 데비 카터의 사촌"

translation.en: and she was murdered on December the 8th.
So she lived here exactly two months.
It's heartbreaking to think that's... that she died right in that room.
translation.ko: 저 방에서 죽었다고 생각하니까 가슴이 아프네요

translation.en: I have specific memories about Debbie.
I did go to her apartment a couple of times.
There were still stuffed animals on the bed.
I mean, it looked like just a bigger version of,
you know, a teenager's room.
I was just so amazed by that.
Debbie was very independent.
She wanted to do her own thing,
translation.ko: 자기 일은 스스로 하고 "글레나 존스 크리스티의 어머니"

translation.en: and, you know, have things on her terms.
When she, um...
graduated high school, she moved out.
She had her own apartment.
She wanted to have her-- [stammers] a job, a career.
She wanted to be on her own, make her own money.
She was employed at the Coachlight.
You might refer to it as a boot scootin' bar.
There was lots of dancing and bands and that sort of thing.
[Christy] One other memory that I have was that we were sitting on the couch
translation.ko: 또 언제는 둘이 같이 소파에 앉아 있었는데

translation.en: and I was driving her crazy about pulling me around the block
translation.ko: 제가 스케이트를 신을 테니 골목에서 끌어달라고

translation.en: on my skates. And, I guess I finally wore her down,
and she pulled me around the entire block twice
translation.ko: 일하러 나가기 전에 저를 데리고 나가서

translation.en: on my skates before she went to work.
So, I guess I wore her down quite a bit. [chuckles]
When Debbie was murdered,
she was actually-- lived a couple of blocks from my house, where my mom and I lived.
translation.ko: 저랑 엄마가 사는 집에서 두 블록 옆에 살고 있었어요

translation.en: So it was really a trying time for, not...
translation.ko: "크리스티 셰퍼드의 집" 그래서 우리 가족은 물론이고

translation.en: you know, not just my family, but for the whole town
'cause nothing like that had happened here before.
When Debbie was killed, it really changed the dynamics
of our family.
Debbie's dad's name was Charlie and my Aunt Peggy, we call her Peppy.
translation.ko: 데비의 아빠는 찰리고 엄마는 '페피'라고 부르는 페기 이모예요

translation.en: I'm Peggy Sue Carter
and I'm Debbie Carter's mother.
translation.ko: 데비 카터의 엄마인 페기 수 카터입니다

translation.en: [Christy] Peppy likes to say that she's the reason that we're all here in Ada.
translation.ko: 페피 이모는 우리가 자기 덕에 에이다에 오게 된 걸 좋아해요

translation.en: Because Peppy had come over here when she married Charlie.
translation.ko: 이모가 찰리와 결혼하면서 먼저 이곳에 오게 됐고

translation.en: And everybody kind of followed.
[Peppy] Since '59...
I married her daddy in '59.
I had her oldest sister in, uh, '60.
A year later, I had Debbie, in '61.
Then I had my third daughter, in '63.
I got the three daughters.
See, I'd had this...
bad, weird feeling, and I told Debbie about it.
translation.ko: 안 좋은 예감이 들어서 데비에게도 말해줬죠

translation.en: She said, "Mama, you're so silly. Don't be like that."
translation.ko: 데비는 말도 안 된다면서 그런 소리 말라고 했어요

translation.en: But I did.
I remember that feeling, it was awful.
That morning,
I know I was changing the sheets on my bed.
And right after I talked to my sister...
I started-- Went back in the bedroom and started to put the sheet on
translation.ko: 다시 방에 돌아가서 덮개를 마저 바꾸고 있는데

translation.en: and the phone rung again.
[Peppy] So I picked it up. "Hello?"
And it's not my little sister.
It's Debbie's friend.
And she saw Debbie's car at home.
And she said, as she started up the stairs,
she heard this loud... music.
And then she said, when she got to the porch,
"There's all this glass."
[Christy] Debbie's friend had found her...
and called my aunt.
She was very panicked and told Peppy that,
you know, Debbie was laying on the floor and that,
you know, there was blood.
So Peppy runs out, and... [sighs]
...her car won't start.
Probably by the grace of God.
[Peppy] I call Christy's mother, Glenna.
-There's no answer. -[phone ringing]
I call Debbie's phone, there's no answer.
I'm going crazy. I don't know what to do.
translation.ko: 정말 미쳐버릴 것 같았고 어쩔 줄을 몰랐어요

translation.en: I'm in there, in my dining room,
talking to Debbie, talking to that picture.
"Honey, you're going to be okay.
Mom will be there just as soon as I can get there."
I started walking up the hill there.
Well, I seen my best friend's car.
She had my sister in there. Glenna, Christy's mother.
translation.ko: 그 안에 여동생이 있더라고요 크리스티 엄마가요

translation.en: [Glenna] I remember, she saw me sitting in a car...
translation.ko: 그때 언니가 차 안에 있는 저를 봤는데...

translation.en: And...
I never said a word, she just knew.
[Peppy] I don't know what happened to me. I just... I couldn't help it.
translation.ko: 왜 그랬는지 모르겠어요 몸이 절로 움직였어요

translation.en: I'm a-balling and a-squalling, and just having a fit.
translation.ko: 소리 지르고 울고 그냥 발작을 일으켰죠

translation.en: I guess, when I did believe it, that night about 7:30.
translation.ko: 저녁 7시 반쯤이 되어서야 그 사실이 믿어졌어요

translation.en: This detective come by that...
I know he leaned down and he kept patting me on my knee.
translation.ko: 몸을 앞으로 기울이고 제 무릎을 토닥이면서

translation.en: And he kept saying,
"Peggy, it happened. It happened to Debbie."
And I just sit there and cry.
I just sit in that chair and cry.
I don't know what to do.
My girl-- My daughter's gone.
I just kept looking at him and he kept telling me,
translation.ko: 형사를 멍하니 바라보는데 계속 그 말만 하더군요

translation.en: "Peggy, it happened, and it happened to Debbie.
It happened to you and Debbie."
[Dan] I first heard about this case from a lawyer friend of mine in 2000.
translation.ko: 제 변호사 친구가 이 사건에 대해 알려준 게 2000년이었어요

translation.en: And, uh, almost immediately,
we were surprised at the way this case was handled.
Ada Police, Dennis Smith, was one of the first investigators on the scene.
translation.ko: "형사들" 현장에 처음 도착한 수사관은 에이다 경찰 데니스 스미스였어요

translation.en: They had a, uh...
patrolman answer and he called in Dennis Smith.
translation.ko: 순찰자가 확인한 후 데니스 스미스를 부른 거죠

translation.en: [Judge Landrith] Uh, Dennis Smith was the...
translation.ko: "데니스 스미스 경찰 수사 지휘관" 데니스 스미스는

translation.en: senior detective for the Ada Police Department.
His reputation,
as far as being a good officer,
was impeccable.
But he was normally in charge of whatever...
big case was happening.
[Dan] Most people seemed to like him. He was a pretty friendly guy.
And, as a matter of fact, his daughter went to school
with Debbie Carter and they were friends.
So, he had a personal connection there.
The crime scene was a total mess.
Debbie's body was lying naked on the floor,
except she had a cord wrapped around her neck.
She had "Duke Graham" written on her back
and "die" on her chest.
On the walls was written,
"Jim Smith next will die."
And on the kitchen table was written,
"Don't look fore us or ealse."
And "for" and "else" were both misspelled.
translation.ko: 이렇게 적혀 있는데 철자 몇 개가 틀렸었어요

translation.en: There was a palm print on the wall.
And, before she was killed,
someone had raped Debbie Carter.
And evidently, it was like Grand Central Station over there,
translation.ko: 듣기로는 현장도 난장판이고 경관들도 하도 들락거려서

translation.en: as far as police officers or a crime scene.
[Dan] Jim Smith and Duke Graham, both of them had alibis, and...
translation.ko: '짐 스미스'와 '듀크 그레이엄'은 둘 다 알리바이가 있었고

translation.en: well, neither one of them gave statements that, that fit anything.
translation.ko: 둘의 진술에도 사건과 관련된 게 하나도 없었어요

translation.en: And they just didn't have anything on either one of them.
translation.ko: 그 둘을 범인으로 볼 근거가 전혀 없었죠

translation.en: Dennis Smith came in and immediately saw that he would need some help,
translation.ko: 데니스 스미스는 현장을 보고 도움이 필요할 거라고 생각했고

translation.en: so he called the Oklahoma State Bureau of Investigation.
To help him with the crime scene.
Gary Rogers, he was the OSBI agent,
which is Oklahoma State Bureau of Investigation.
Gary had been a former, uh, police officer in Shawnee.
translation.ko: "게리 로저스 OSBI 요원" 게리는 전직 경찰관으로 쇼니에서 근무했었는데

translation.en: He was a rancher.
And always wore a hat and boots,
and jeans, and belt with a coat and tie.
translation.ko: 청바지랑 코트를 입고 벨트랑 넥타이를 했어요

translation.en: [Dan] Dennis and Gary basically worked the crime scene.
translation.ko: "게리 로저스, 데니스 스미스" 데니스와 게리가 현장을 맡아서 수사했어요

translation.en: They would funnel their reports to Bill Peterson,
translation.ko: 그렇게 작성한 보고서를 사건 담당 검사였던

translation.en: who was the prosecutor of the case.
I've known Bill Peterson for all my life.
He, uh, went to Ada High School.
Um, he went to University of Oklahoma.
He did go through some prep schools back East.
translation.ko: 동부에 있을 땐 사립고에 잠깐 다녔었죠

translation.en: His father was a doctor
and his mother was a, a member of the Norris family.
I would say Bill was more of a folksy-type DA,
translation.ko: 빌로 말하자면 서민적인 느낌의 검사였던 것 같아요

translation.en: where he would, uh, tell stories.
Which is a very effective way. When picking a jury
translation.ko: 친근하게 이야기하는 듯한 모습이 배심원을 고를 때

translation.en: is to be somewhat folksy and tell stories.
He could get angry. [sighs]
I think we all feel the pressure to do what's right.
translation.ko: 옳은 일을 해야 한다는 압박감은 모두에게 있어요

translation.en: And I know, since my nephew is a prosecutor,
translation.ko: 제 조카도 검사 일을 해서 알고 있는데

translation.en: they have that kind of police mentality.
translation.ko: 검사는 경찰과 비슷한 가치관을 갖고 있어요

translation.en: They're prosecutors for a reason.
You're not going to make a lot of money in your life being a prosecutor.
translation.ko: 평생을 검사로 살면 돈은 많이 못 만지거든요

translation.en: You like to put...
bad people in jail.
And protect your constituents. I believe that.
translation.ko: 주민들을 보호하기 위해서요 저는 그렇게 믿어요

translation.en: Somebody took some time to really stage that crime scene.
translation.ko: "여자 살인 사건 용의자는 0명" 범인은 시간을 들여서 현장을 정성스레 조작했어요

translation.en: You know, most people panic and they leave,
and they leave all kinds of stuff. This...
Whoever did this was really thinking about trying to create a diversion.
translation.ko: 이 범인은 의심을 분산하려고 많은 고민을 했죠

translation.en: Dennis Smith had made a comment that before he retired...
translation.ko: 데니스 스미스가 선언을 했는데 자신이 은퇴하기 전에

translation.en: that he would...
solve Debbie's case.
When something like this happens to...
your family or to the town, you know, it's the ripple effect.
translation.ko: 지역 안에서 벌어지면 그로 인한 파급 효과가 있어요

translation.en: I always like to say that it's like a tsunami.
You know, you don't even recognize that it was coming.
It just takes everything away.
[Dawn] That was a huge shock.
You think, "Who was it? Somebody in this community?"
translation.ko: '이 동네 사람이 그랬다고?' 이런 의문이 들거든요

translation.en: [Grisham] I'm sure it was, um...
you know, terrifying in a small town like that.
And then, um...
two or three years later, Denice Haraway disappeared.
♪ Sweet dreams of you ♪
[woman] Denice worked at the little Quick Stop out on Highway One.
We were very concerned because Denice had disappeared,
translation.ko: 드니스가 사라졌다는 소식에 다들 걱정이 심해서

translation.en: and so the word spread quickly.
By the way, Denice worked for me for, um, a semester.
translation.ko: 드니스는 한 학기 동안 제 밑에서 일했었어요 "빌리 진 플로이드 에이다 역사 협회장"

translation.en: Part of a semester.
A real, sweet little girl,
and she worked for me when she was in school,
at East Central.
She was working as a work-study student.
Just as sweet as could be. Nice.
Just a pretty little girl, you know, that was in college
and needed a job.
And I had an opening for a work-study student
translation.ko: 저는 당시 비서로 일해줄 근로 학생을

translation.en: to be my secretary.
The town was in disbelief, you know, at what had happened.
translation.ko: 그런데 그런 애가 사라졌다니까 주민들은 믿지를 못했죠

translation.en: They would search out by Lawrence and out southwest of town.
translation.ko: 로렌스 지역과 남서쪽 외곽까지도 수색을 해봤는데

translation.en: And there was all kinds of strange stories going around
where they were looking.
Because, apparently, there was no rhyme or reason.
translation.ko: 왜냐면 실종될 이유가 전혀 없었다는 거죠

translation.en: I don't know what was happening. I just know that there were many rumors
translation.ko: 어떻게 된 건지 감을 못 잡았어요 그저 드니스의 행방에 대한

translation.en: about where she might be.
[Dan] On April 28th, 1984,
at about 8:30 at night, Denice Haraway was working in the, uh...
a little convenience store on the east side of Ada, Oklahoma,
translation.ko: 오클라호마 에이다 동쪽에 있는 작은 편의점에서 근무 중이었어요

translation.en: when Gene Whelchel and his two nephews were getting ready to go to a card game.
translation.ko: 진 웰첼이라는 남자가 조카 둘과 카드놀이를 하러 가는 중에

translation.en: And they stopped by the convenience store
to get some cigarettes and some change.
They saw a man and a woman walk out
translation.ko: 남자 한 명과 여자 한 명이 편의점에서 나왔는데

translation.en: and get into the passenger side of a pickup and drive off.
translation.ko: 여자를 트럭 조수석에 태우고 떠났다고 해요

translation.en: So we stopped at, uh...
McAnally's to get change for the poker game.
translation.ko: 동전이 필요해서 매커낼리 주유소에 들렀어요 "목격자 진 웰첼의 목소리"

translation.en: And I waited in the pickup.
My nephew went inside, Lenny.
And he came back out in a little bit and said there wasn't anybody in there.
translation.ko: 그런데 조카가 나오더니 안에 아무도 없다는 거예요

translation.en: We went in and kinda looked the place over. Discovered that--
Figured that something was wrong.
So we called the police.
[Dan] Money was taken out of their drawer.
Whoever was there made a quick grab for the money and obviously took the girl.
translation.ko: 누가 순식간에 돈을 가지고 피해자를 데려간 거죠

translation.en: Gene: I know it was her that left as we pulled up.
translation.ko: 우리가 도착했을 때 나온 게 그 여자 맞아요

translation.en: [Dan] They put an APB out for a faded, light blue pickup truck
translation.ko: 색 바랜 하늘색 트럭으로 전국 수배령을 내렸어요

translation.en: with a straight bed, with gray primer spots on it.
translation.ko: 납작한 트렁크였고 회색 밑칠 페인트가 묻어 있었죠

translation.en: And they, uh, stopped a number of people, and developed information,
translation.ko: 사람들을 불러 세워서 제보를 받긴 했지만

translation.en: but they didn't find the girl with any of that.
Then, later on that night,
translation.ko: 그런데 같은 날 밤 바로 근처에 있는

translation.en: they went to a store just down the street.
translation.ko: 그런데 같은 날 밤 바로 근처에 있는 "매커낼리 편의점 드니스 납치"

translation.en: J.P.'s
translation.ko: "JP 팩투고 잠재적 용의자 목격" JP 가게에 갔더니

translation.en: And the, uh, clerk there, her name is Karen Wise.
She then reported that she saw a couple of people
that she felt were suspicious and she was worried about.
They kind of scared her. They went into her store
translation.ko: 무서워 보이는 사람들이 불과 몇 시간 전에

translation.en: just a few hours earlier.
She is also the one that gave a composite sketch
of the two guys that she thought was in her store that night.
translation.ko: 두 남자의 몽타주를 그릴 수 있었어요

translation.en: They showed it to Gene Whelchel and he said that he thinks
that looks sort of like the guy that they saw.
Pretty soon, they published that composite
translation.ko: "경찰, 실종된 점원 수색 중" 곧 경찰에서는

translation.en: that she had made in the Ada newspaper.
translation.ko: 캐런이 만든 몽타주를 지역 신문에 내보냈어요

translation.en: People started calling in. "I know a guy that looks like this.
translation.ko: 그러자 이런 사람을 안다거나 떠오르는 사람이 있다면서

translation.en: I know a guy." And all these names started pouring in.
A guy by the name of Billy Charley was identified.
Billy Charley had an alibi. He was home with his parents that night.
translation.ko: 빌리는 알리바이가 있었어요 그날 집에서 부모님과 있었죠

translation.en: And then they started getting quite a few calls about Tommy Ward.
translation.ko: 그런데 '토미 워드'라는 이름도 여러 번 제보되기 시작했어요

translation.en: Man 1: Okay, Tommy, I've got a few things I need to say first.
translation.ko: "1984년 10월 18일 토미 워드 심문" 좋아, 토미 일단 내가 몇 가지 말할게

translation.en: The date today is October 18th, 1984.
We're at the headquarters office
of the Oklahoma State Bureau of Investigation located in Oklahoma City.
translation.ko: 오클라호마주 수사국의 본부 사무실에서 얘기 중이야

translation.en: I'm Deputy Inspector Rusty Featherstone.
Present also in the room, is Special Agent Gary Rogers of the OSBI.
translation.ko: 동석 인원은 오클라호마주 수사국 에이다 지부에서 나온

translation.en: Out of the Ada office.
Captain Dennis Smith
of the Ada Police Department, Detective Division.
I know we've already talked about it a little bit,
but what I'd like you to do at this point, is just start on that afternoon,
translation.ko: 네가 할 건 그날 오후의 일을 얘기하는 거야

translation.en: and just in your own words, at your own speed,
translation.ko: 네가 하고 싶은 대로 말하면 돼

translation.en: I want you to go step by step through everything that happened
translation.ko: 실종된 여자애와 관련해서 그날 저녁 무슨 일이 있었는지

translation.en: through the rest of that evening, involving this girl.
-Okay? -Okay.
Featherstone: Just go ahead and begin.
My name is Johnny Lee Daniels.
I've known Tommy Ward...
since we were childhood kids.
translation.ko: "조니 리 대니얼스 토미 워드의 친구" 어릴 때부터 알고 지냈죠

translation.en: Boy, we did a whole lot of running around on the back roads
translation.ko: "토미 워드, 조니 대니얼스" 어릴 적에 같이 뒷골목에서 뜀박질도 하고

translation.en: and drinking back in the day when we was young
and didn't have no sense.
He was just, um...
a pretty quiet person in general.
Can you tell me what her blouse looked like,
that she was wearing?
It was...
It was...
white with little blue...
uh, roses on it.
White with blue roses.
[lady] At that point in time, you're kinda seen the downfall.
I didn't know if I was going to see him when he wasn't...
on some kind of drugs or alcohol.
translation.ko: "트리샤 울프 토미 워드의 누나" 상상하기가 힘들 정도였거든요

translation.en: He was a total different person.
[man] Tommy had his run-in with the police.
They looked at Tommy as a ruffian.
A lower class person.
And the police didn't like him for some reason.
translation.ko: "버드 울프 토미 워드의 매형" 경찰관들이 왜인지 토미를 싫어했어요

translation.en: I have no idea why.
Unless it was just those things, you know? I mean, Tommy liked to drink.
translation.ko: 그럴 이유가 거기서 거기잖아요? 토미는 술도 좋아했거든요

translation.en: I... I was at a...
keg party.
And I ran into a couple of guys.
Asked me if I wanted to go riding around with them and go get high,
translation.ko: 같이 차 타고 돌아다니면서 약에 취하고

translation.en: and drink some beer. And I told 'em, "Sure."
My name is Robert Mayer.
translation.ko: 로버트 메이어라고 합니다 "로버트 메이어 '에이다의 꿈' 저자"

translation.en: I'm originally from New York City.
When I graduated from college and journalism school,
I became a reporter.
I had...
no conception whatever, if these guys were guilty or innocent.
translation.ko: 이 친구들이 유죄인지 무죄인지 아무것도 모르고 있었어요

translation.en: I thought, "Well, I'll look into it and see how far it goes."
And so that's how I got into the book that later became The Dreams of Ada.
translation.ko: 책을 쓰기 시작했고 그게 '에이다의 꿈'이 되었죠

translation.en: And the confession of, "Was anybody else there?"
"Yeah, well, the ringleader, the guy who's idea it was,
translation.ko: 오델 티츠워스라는 남자가 계획을 전부 세우고

translation.en: was Odell Titsworth."
[Robert] And Odell Titsworth was this Indian fellow
who uh, was known, had a reputation among the cops
as a bad dude.
Titsworth, he grabbed money out of the register,
and we went out to the pickup.
Featherstone: Where did you go from there?
Out to the power plant.
Featherstone: What did he say he was gonna do with her?
He told me that he was going to kill her.
Now, the other person he had mentioned was...
Carl Fontenot.
Featherstone: What was the purpose of taking her with you?
From the store?
To keep from her... coming to y'all and letting y'all know.
I mean, was that the plan, though, whenever you went there?
-Yes. -Okay.
We had it all planned out, you know, to...
What were you planning on doing with her after you got her?
-Raping her. -Raping her and
-then killing her and getting rid of her? -Yes.
Okay.
[Johnny] Karl Fontenot I've known Karl Fontenot since we were little kids.
translation.ko: 칼 폰테노도 꼬맹이 시절부터 아는 친구예요

translation.en: Karl...
was a little slow when it come to his thinking.
As we was going to McAnally's, we stopped there at the apartments,
translation.ko: 매커낼리에 가기 전에 집에 잠깐 들렀어요

translation.en: and decided to smoke some pot and get high and everything.
translation.ko: 대마초 피우고 약 기운 좀 받으려고요

translation.en: We drank some.
Then when we got-- We planned it out before we got there.
And then, when we got there...
Odell...
set it up for us and everything.
He took her out of the store.
Brought her to the truck.
Featherstone: Where were y'all at? Karl?
Right there by the gas pumps.
[Johnny] He was just someone that pretty much stayed to hisself,
translation.ko: 다른 사람들이랑은 별로 교류가 없는 친구였어요

translation.en: even though he was not a violent guy or anything like that.
translation.ko: 폭력적인 사람이라거나 그런 건 절대 아니었고요

translation.en: He just pretty much stayed to hisself, and then...
when his mom got killed, I believe he seen his mom get killed,
translation.ko: 자기 엄마가 죽는 광경을 목격했다고 한 것 같은데

translation.en: he-- he just kinda really stayed more to hisself.
translation.ko: 그때부터는 정말 세상과 단절된 채 살았죠

translation.en: He, uh...
translation.ko: 의지가 전혀 없어서 일도 안 하고

translation.en: He had pretty much no ambition to work, or really do anything.
translation.ko: 의지가 전혀 없어서 일도 안 하고 아무것도 안 했어요

translation.en: [Robert] Karl's father used to beat Karl when he was a little boy,
translation.ko: 칼은 어릴 적에 자기 아버지한테 맞고 자랐어요

translation.en: and they had dogs and cats and sheep
translation.ko: 칼의 집 작은 마당에서는 개, 고양이, 양

translation.en: and whatever else you can think of out there in that little yard.
translation.ko: 그 외에도 온갖 동물들을 기르고 있었는데

translation.en: And Karl's father...
would...
have sex with animals...
in front of Karl.
-Featherstone: Was she scared? -She was scared.
-Featherstone: What was she saying? -She was hollering for help.
And then there was nobody around for to help.
[man] I didn't know anything about Karl Fontenot
until I received a call
translation.ko: 전화를 받았어요 "조지 버트너 칼 폰테노의 변호사"

translation.en: from, um, District Judge Ron Jones...
asking if I would accept a court appointment
to represent Mr. Fontenot.
And I thought he was competent in, in all respects.
translation.ko: 칼은 어떻게 봐도 재판받는 데에 무리가 없었어요

translation.en: The real problem with that was the confession tapes.
They were in bold color...
and, and, and basically were...
just came across really somewhat...
cold-blooded, matter-of-factly, emotionless...
Featherstone: So...
Odell Titsworth crawled up inside the pickup.
translation.ko: 오델 티츠워스가 트럭 위로 올라간 거지?

translation.en: Fontenot: Yes.
Did he have something in his hand?
-Had his knife. -Featherstone: Was it open?
Yes, it was open. And he... he was attempting to stab her.
-And... -Featherstone: Did you see him stab her?
-He was stabbing her. -Featherstone: How did he do it?
-He had the knife in his hand, like this. -All right.
And he was... stabbing.
-Featherstone: Hard? -Yes.
How hard?
-Show me how hard. -Enough to get the full blade in.
Like that.
Featherstone: Where was the first place that she was cut with the knife?
translation.ko: 가장 먼저 칼로 그은 부분이 어디야?

translation.en: In her side. Right here in the side, that's where Titsworth cut her.
When he started to rape her, he goes,
"If you don't cooperate with me and everything,"
he says, "I'll cut you deeper."
After that, me and Odell stood there and holded her while Tommy raped her.
translation.ko: 그다음 토미가 강간하는 동안 저랑 오델이 잡고 있었어요

translation.en: Okay.
She had tremendous cuts all over her body, all in her sides and on her legs.
translation.ko: 베인 데가 수없이 많았어요 옆구리랑 다리에도 가득했죠

translation.en: -Featherstone: Were they deep cuts? -And on the side of her neck.
Yeah, the ones in her stomach was.
-How could you tell they were deep cuts? -I could see her ribs and her insides.
translation.ko: - 깊다는 건 어떻게 알았어? - 갈비뼈랑 내장이 보였으니까요

translation.en: Featherstone: Was she saying anything?
She was hollering for help and telling us to stop.
Featherstone: Do you believe that she died
due to any other reason, other than the stab wounds?
No, that's what she died of, the stab wounds.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 칼에 찔린 것 때문에 죽은 거예요

translation.en: Featherstone: How many times did you cut her with the knife, Tommy?
Twice. Once upon her side and once down her arm.
translation.ko: 두 번요, 옆구리 한 번 베고 팔을 쭉 그었어요

translation.en: Featherstone: What do you mean, you had her "under control"?
Well, she was more or less giving up.
Okay.
At the end.
Featherstone: Try and beg y'all not to hurt her or...?
She goes, "Tommy, I didn't think you'd ever do anything like this."
[Johnny] I'd been in and out enough, couple of times,
that I was in that bullpen with Karl.
He sat next to me in that jailhouse and said... [sighs]
translation.ko: 제 옆에 앉아 있던 칼이 이렇게 말했었어요

translation.en: "I'm glad they're locking me up because I don't have to worry
about a place to sleep or where I'm going to get my next meal."
translation.ko: '어디서 잘지 무슨 밥 먹을지 고민 안 해도 되잖아'

translation.en: And that's exactly what he said.
Featherstone: Karl?
During the period of time that we've interviewed you, today...
Once again, I'd like to ask you, have we threatened you or...
translation.ko: 우리가 너를 협박한 적이 있는지 묻고 싶어

translation.en: -No. -...promised you anything?
You're making this of your own free will, this statement?
It was of my own free will to get this recorded.
Have you been allowed to smoke, drink,
translation.ko: 취조 중에 담배도 피우고 물도 마시고

translation.en: -drink Cokes... -Yes.
...anything that you wanted?
Yes, I was served right during the meeting.
translation.ko: 네, 얘기하는 동안 부당한 대우는 안 받았어요

translation.en: Once again, Tommy, I want to reiterate,
you're giving this statement of your own free will?
Yes, sir.
Is there anything else that you'd like to add, to this tape recording,
translation.ko: 혹시 자백 영상에 추가하고 싶은 말이 있니?

translation.en: prior to us shutting it off?
I knew, if...
I knew I wouldn't have done it if I wasn't drunk,
translation.ko: 만약 취하지 않았으면 안 했을 거예요

translation.en: 'cause I thought it was just a dream.
So immediately, and this was in-- And this was like...
around midnight, or whenever they were questioned.
So, then they tell them, "You're under arrest for kidnapping, rape, and murder."
translation.ko: 거기서 바로 납치, 강간, 살인죄로 둘을 체포해버린 거죠

translation.en: And then they called the headquarters in Ada.
They sent cops to Odell Titsworth's house.
They knew him from various...
run-ins with the law.
[Robert] They get to Odell Titsworth's house and he's there with his mother
translation.ko: 오델 티츠워스는 집에서 어머니와 같이 있었는데

translation.en: and they accuse him.
Anyway, the mother says,
"Odell couldn't have done that.
He was home with a broken arm that the police broke two nights before."
translation.ko: '이틀 전에 경찰들이 팔을 부러뜨려서 집에만 있었는데'

translation.en: So the cops are thinking, "That the police broke? What are you talking about?"
[Robert] So that's what their description
translation.ko: 오델이 사건 당일 밤에 뭘 하고 있었는지 묻자

translation.en: of what Odell was doing the night of the crime.
translation.ko: 오델이 사건 당일 밤에 뭘 하고 있었는지 묻자 그렇게 대답한 건데

translation.en: Well, that's easy enough to prove.
And so the police officers,
they go down to the hospital, and they keep records.
And sure enough, on that date, Odell Titsworth had been treated
and he had a broken arm,
the humerus, which is up here.
And was told that he's even going to have to sleep in a chair
translation.ko: 심지어는 한 달 이상 의자에 앉아서 자야 한다는

translation.en: for like a month or so.
So the mother and Odell were not lying. There was proof,
translation.ko: 결국 오델과 어머니 말이 맞았던 거죠

translation.en: in the police department itself, that he was in no condition
translation.ko: 사건 당일에 사람을 들고 울타리를 넘을 상태가

translation.en: that night to lift bodies over fences and so forth.
Now they've got a problem. It's on the confession tape.
translation.ko: 자백 내용과 사실이 다르다는 문제가 생긴 거예요

translation.en: It's a big thing, a part of the tape, like, Odell was the leader,
that he was at home with a broken arm that night.
translation.ko: 알고 보니 그날 팔이 부러져서 집에 있었던 거죠

translation.en: [woman] I was actually still in school,
but I was a radio newscaster at the time.
translation.ko: 라디오 방송에서 뉴스를 진행하고 있었어요 "스테이시 셸턴 에이다 뉴스 기자"

translation.en: And we had the only radio news team
in the city, at the time.
And so we covered all of the trials and any of the big news going on there.
translation.ko: 중요 소식이나 재판 내용은 우리가 전부 보도했었죠

translation.en: I know that there were several unsolved murders
translation.ko: 그때 미제 여성 살인 사건이 여럿이었다는 건

translation.en: of women at the time.
The Deborah Carter case was unsolved.
And, um, there was a lot of public pressure being put
translation.ko: 그래서 경찰국과 지방 검사실은 "해러웨이 사건 도움 요망"

translation.en: on the police department, the District Attorney's office
translation.ko: 사건을 해결해야 한다는 "FBI에 살인 사건 지원 요청"

translation.en: to make sure that these were solved.
translation.ko: "까다로운 사건으로 경찰 고전" 심한 압박을 받고 있었어요

translation.en: Dennis Smith told me one time, and actually it was Labor Day.
translation.ko: 데니스 스미스에게 들은 얘기예요 그때가 노동절이었을 거예요

translation.en: Uh, we were sitting right in front of the courthouse and Dennis told me
translation.ko: 법원 앞에 있는데 그러더군요 "데니스 스미스 경찰 수사 지휘관"

translation.en: that, uh, he asked his wife,
translation.ko: "데니스 스미스 경찰 수사 지휘관" 자기가 아내에게 물어봤대요

translation.en: "What do you want to do today?" They both had the day off.
translation.ko: '오늘 뭐 하고 싶어?' 둘 다 쉬는 날이었던 거죠

translation.en: And she said...
"Let's-- Let's go look for Denice Haraway's body."
translation.ko: 드니스 해러웨이의 시신을 찾자고 했다는 거예요

translation.en: And this was, again, three months later.
That's how this town was, was gripped by this thing.
translation.ko: 그만큼 동네 사람들이 사로잡혀 있던 거예요

translation.en: The authorities never found Denice Haraway's body
in the Ward and Fontenot case.
[Robert] I always thought...
that for a murder charge you had to have the body.
translation.ko: 살인이 성립되려면 시체가 있어야 되는 줄 알았어요

translation.en: And Bill Peterson explained to me, and of course he was dead on right,
that corpus delicti means "the body of the crime."
translation.ko: "빌 피터슨 지방 검사" 범죄의 핵심 증거, 즉 '체소'가 시체를 대체할 수 있다는 거예요

translation.en: If that was not the law, then anybody who was good at hiding a body
translation.ko: 만약 시체가 없다고 무죄라면 시체 숨기는 재주만 좋아도

translation.en: could get away with murder.
And that's why you don't-- they don't have to produce the body,
translation.ko: 그래서 시체를 제시하는 게 필수는 아닌 거죠

translation.en: just evidence that a crime was committed.
But it doesn't have to be the body.
[Judge] The prosecution has to prove that nobody's seen her here.
translation.ko: 검찰 측에서 확보해야 하는 건 피해자를 못 봤다는 진술이었죠

translation.en: Nobody's seen her at church. Nobody saw her at school.
Nobody saw her at home, etc.
It is very rare.
I only know of maybe
three cases where that's been done.
translation.ko: 제가 아는 것도 세 건밖에 없었어요

translation.en: [Robert] The date for the trial had been set.
So they were tried for robbery,
kidnapping, and murder.
The atmosphere was tense.
Some members of the Haraway family sat in.
Some members of Tommy Ward's family sat in on the trial.
translation.ko: 토미 워드의 식구들도 몇 명 참석했어요

translation.en: I was waiting for Denice Haraway to walk back through the door.
translation.ko: 저는 드니스 해러웨이가 문을 열고 들어오길 바랐어요

translation.en: -Yeah. -I honestly was.
At the trial, just walk in.
-I honestly was. -But never happened.
Never happened.
Both Don Wyatt, who represented Tommy Ward, and I...
translation.ko: 토미 워드의 변호사였던 돈 와이엇과 저는 둘 다

translation.en: knew that we were facing uphill battles
translation.ko: 힘든 싸움이 될 걸 알았어요 "범죄의 체소"

translation.en: because there was no body.
[Dan] Bill Peterson was the main prosecutor. He had...
Chris Ross was helping with his case.
Chris was a very effective attorney. Very smart. Could think on his feet.
translation.ko: "크리스 로스 지방 검사보" 크리스는 뛰어난 법조인이었어요 아주 영리했고 생각이 빨랐죠

translation.en: [Robert] The prosecution, as is normal in such cases, went first.
translation.ko: 이런 사건이 으레 그렇듯 검찰 측이 먼저 시작했어요

translation.en: And Bill Peterson has a mindset of presenting a story.
translation.ko: 빌 피터슨의 사고 흐름은 항상 이야기처럼 진행되죠

translation.en: So he started with the fellow who came and found...
translation.ko: 그래서 주유소에 들렀던 목격자 얘기로 시작했어요

translation.en: you know, who saw the couple walking out and thought they were lovers,
translation.ko: 남녀가 나오는 걸 보고 연인인 줄 알았는데

translation.en: and then went in and found that she was missing.
translation.ko: 편의점에 들어갔다가 실종자라는 걸 알게 된 거죠

translation.en: Like I said, I saw her periodically.
I didn't recognize her when she came out.
But after I got in the store and nobody was there, I said,
translation.ko: 들어가서 아무도 없으니까 이런 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: "That girl that just left is the girl that works here."
I told my nephews that.
No, I know.
There's no doubt in my mind that she was taken.
As we arrived.
[Robert] They called Karen Wise.
The girl who worked up the road at J.P.'s Pack-To-Go.
translation.ko: 근처 JP 팩투고 가게에서 일하던 여자죠

translation.en: [Robert] And asked if those were the two people who were messing around in her store.
translation.ko: 가게에 와서 건들거리던 두 사람이 피고인들이 맞냐고 물으니까

translation.en: And she said, "Without a doubt."
She testified that one of them was Tommy Ward.
translation.ko: 토미 워드가 둘 중 한 명이 맞다고 진술했죠

translation.en: There's a, uh, woman that testified, called by the prosecutors,
translation.ko: 검찰 측에서 요청한 여자 증인이 한 명 더 있었는데

translation.en: that she had been in the jail for several weeks
translation.ko: 몇 주 동안 감옥에 있던 터라 그 안에서

translation.en: at the same time that Tommy and Karl were there,
before the trial.
And she testified
that she overheard Karl confessing to the crime,
translation.ko: 칼이 범행을 시인하고 피해자를 죽인 과정을 말하는 걸

translation.en: how they had killed the girl.
"Question: 'Would you tell this jury what he said?'
Answer: 'He said that Odell raped her first
translation.ko: "돈 틸 속기사의 목소리" '대답, 오델이 먼저 강간했고'

translation.en: and then it was Tommy's turn.
He bit her on the breast and cut her down the arm.
And Odell killed her, stabbed her to death and killed her.
And then Karl raped her.'
Question: 'When he told you this statement Terri, what was your reaction to that?'
translation.ko: '질문, 이 말을 들었을 때 증인의 기분은 어땠나요?'

translation.en: Answer: 'He scared me.'"
And then, for the denouement,
the final piece of testimony, of evidence,
they played the confession.
Featherstone: You said earlier that you noticed, when you came back up,
translation.ko: 아까 그랬는데 트럭에 다시 올라탔을 때

translation.en: a large amount of blood.
Where all was she bleeding from?
Mostly in her side.
Where the deep cut was.
-Featherstone: And where else? -In the side of her neck, right here.
[Butner] There was only one leader of this two-person church,
translation.ko: 그 두 공범 중에는 우두머리가 한 명이었는데

translation.en: and that was Tommy.
I think that Karl's relationship with Tommy was that
translation.ko: 저는 칼과 토미의 관계를 이렇게 봅니다

translation.en: if Tommy Ward had anything to do with that crime,
Karl would have been there handing him what he needed.
-Featherstone: Was she conscious then? -No. She wasn't very lively at all.
translation.ko: - 그때도 의식이 있었나? - 아뇨 그때는 살아 있다고 하기 뭐했어요

translation.en: -How come? -Because we'd all three raped her.
I knew that she was dead because she was white.
translation.ko: 얼굴이 하얗게 변한 걸 보고 죽었다는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: We had to get rid of her and all,
and he asked me a good place to get rid of her.
And I told him about a house, and about this ditch down by the...
translation.ko: 아는 집이 있는데 도랑 옆에 있는 집이라고 했어요

translation.en: Sandy River.
And then he put her off in the rotten place in the floor.
translation.ko: 토미가 바닥 썩은 부분에 여자애를 내려놨어요

translation.en: -Where was that? -Over where the floor was missing.
[Robert] Once the tapes were played,
uh, the audience was--
the spectators in the room...
they were horrified. And once people saw that...
translation.ko: 겁에 질렸어요 그 영상을 본 이상

translation.en: these people were guilty. How can anybody even say
translation.ko: 두 피고인은 유죄였죠 설령 사실이 아니라고 해도

translation.en: they did things like that?
-Featherstone: You poured gasoline on her? -Yes.
And then what? What did you do after you poured the gas on her?
translation.ko: 그리고 어쨌어? 휘발유 붓고 나서 어떻게 했어?

translation.en: We lit the house.
We lit the gas and burnt the house and her.
translation.ko: 휘발유에 불을 질러서 다 태워 없앴어요

translation.en: [Dawn] That was the first murder trial that I had done
translation.ko: 제가 맡은 첫 번째 살인 사건이었고

translation.en: and it lasted two and a half weeks.
And, um...
I went home at the end of it every day and cried.
translation.ko: "돈 틸 폰토톡 카운티 법원 속기사" 퇴근하고 매일같이 울었어요

translation.en: [Dawn] Every day, hearing bad things...
and so much of it.
And I believed, I believed the evidence.
I think in these particular cases,
Mr. Peterson and Mr. Ross were the prosecutors.
translation.ko: 피터슨 씨와 로스 씨였던 것 같아요

translation.en: It's like they're telling a story and a story unfolding, and, um...
translation.ko: 이야기를 조금씩 풀어가는 것처럼 발언을 진행하는데...

translation.en: for sure, Mr. Ross is a very good...
very good at his job.
[Robert] When Chris Ross began his closing arguments,
he used psychiatry as a way of explaining...
for where the third person came from in the, uh, confession tapes.
translation.ko: 나오게 된 경위를 정신의학을 통해 설명하더군요

translation.en: [Robert] "I submit, ladies and gentlemen...
everything Mr. Ward did in his confession,
translation.ko: "크리스 로스의 최종 논고" '워드 씨는 자백에서 언급하고'

translation.en: things he did in reality,
he blamed on Odell Titsworth.
You'll notice that Odell and Tommy Ward
never did one single, significant thing together.
translation.ko: '함께 한 일이 하나도 없다는 것을 기억하십시오'

translation.en: I submit, ladies and gentlemen,
everything Mr. Ward did in his confession.
He sees himself doing it and then he says that Odell did it.
translation.ko: '자신이 저지른 후 오델이 했다고 말한 겁니다'

translation.en: And this is confusing, but ladies and gentlemen, when he's doing this,
and he recounts what happened, and he sees it in his mind.
He sees himself doing something...
that he tells himself he would never do.
translation.ko: '자신이 할 만한 일이 절대 아니라고 생각하고'

translation.en: He says Odell did that.
I submit to you, Odell Titsworth was Tommy Ward
and he raped her first, and then Karl raped her.
And one of these two men killed Denice Haraway.
translation.ko: '그리고 둘 중 한 명이 드니스 해러웨이를 살해했습니다'

translation.en: One of these two men stabbed her to death.
I submit to you, ladies and gentlemen, that man was Tommy Ward."
translation.ko: '여러분께 말씀드립니다 그 사람은 바로 토미 워드입니다'

translation.en: [Butner] Chris took the confessions
and wove a closing argument and presented it,
and the jury bought it.
And that's what I think was the final nail
translation.ko: 그 최종 논고야말로 유죄 판결에 못을 박은

translation.en: in that coffin of conviction.
The judge goes down all the jurors' votes.
And it was 12 to nothing on all counts.
Featherstone: Are you confused about any of this today
or do you understand what's going on?
-Yes, I understand what's going on. -Okay.
You understand how serious this investigation is?
translation.ko: 이게 실제 수사 과정인 것도 알고 있지?

translation.en: -Yes, I do. -Okay.
We'll end the tape at this time.
I've got 7:29 p.m.
And we'll conclude the tape now.
Still present in the room...
Deputy Inspector Rusty Featherstone, Special Agent Gary Rogers,
translation.ko: 러스티 페더스턴 부조사관과 게리 로저스 특수 요원

translation.en: Captain Dennis Smith, and Agent Dee Cordray,
translation.ko: 데니스 스미스 경감 디 코드레이 요원

translation.en: as well as Tommy Ward.
♪ While I run this race ♪ ♪ Oh, Lord, hold my hand ♪
My name is Thomas Ward.
I've been in prison for the last 33 years for a crime I did not commit.
translation.ko: 짓지 않은 죄로 복역한 지 올해로 33년이 지났습니다
